title: conferred on me by section 63(2)(b) of the Finance Act 2019 (No. 45 of 2019),
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Finance Act 2019 (Section 63(1)(b))
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Finance Act 2019 (Section 63(1)(b)) 

(Commencement) Order 2020.
text_norm: 1 order may cited finance act 2019 (section 63(1)(b)) (commencement) order 2020

title: conferred on me by section 63(2)(b) of the Finance Act 2019 (No. 45 of 2019),
heading: 2. The 14th day of September 2020 is appointed as the day on which section
text_raw:
2. The 14th day of September 2020 is appointed as the day on which section 

63(1)(b) of the Finance Act 2019 (No. 45 of 2019) comes into operation. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

2 September, 2020. 

PASCHAL DONOHOE, 
Minister for Finance. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 8th September, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [334] 3

title: conferred on me by section 63(2)(b) of the Finance Act 2019 (No. 45 of 2019),
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This Order commences section 63(1)(b) of the Finance Act 2019 (No. 45 of 
2019). That section inserts a new section 48A into the Capital Acquisitions Tax 
Consolidation Act 2003 to provide for the electronic delivery of information to 
Revenue by persons who intend to apply for probate in relation to the estate of a 
deceased person on or after the 14th September 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [334]
